title: Ticket #812: Startd's Starter::reallykill duplicates code in DaemonCore:Send_Signal
description: There's a whole mess of code in the startd's Starter class, in method reallykill, to decide whether to send a bona-fide unix signal to the starter, or to use DaemonCore::Send_Signal. DC:Send_Signal, though, basically does the same thing, with a few differences, which are probably bugs in one or the other. We should rip all that code out of the startd, and put in in daemoncore, where it belongs. Question: what about similar issues with the schedd and shadows?
